    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static BaseAuthenticationToken parse(String stringBST,
                                            boolean isEncoded)
                                     throws org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException
        Creates an instance of BaseAuthenticationToken by parsing the given credential string. The passed boolean indicates if the provided credentials are encoded or not. If the string contains the necessary components (username, password, realm), a new instance of BaseAuthenticationToken is created and initialized with the credentials. If not, a null value is returned.
        Parameters:
        stringBST - unencoded credentials string
        Returns:
        initialized username/password token if parsed successfully, null otherwise
        Throws:
        org.apache.wss4j.common.ext.WSSecurityException

      • parseComponent

        protected static String parseComponent(String s,
                                       String expectedStartsWith)

      • getCredentialsAsXMLString

        public String getCredentialsAsXMLString()
        Description copied from class: BaseAuthenticationToken
        Returns the credentials as an XML string suitable for injecting into a STS request. This default behavior assumes that the credentials actually are stored in their XML representation. If a subclass stores them differently, it is up to them to override this method.
        Overrides:
        getCredentialsAsXMLString in class BaseAuthenticationToken
        Returns:
        String containing the XML representation of this token's credentials
